title: Everglades National Park: Donate
body: Donate         Flamingo experienced serious damages during Hurricanes of 2005.  The Park is currently working toward replacing overnight accommodations lost and sorely missed by visitors.   Everglades National Park is able to accept donations directly, or through its friends group the South Florida National Parks Trust. Public support is an essential element in the management, preservation, and restoration of National Park Service lands. No other federal agency relies as heavily on the generosity and kindness of its visitors. Donations may be dedicated to enhancing your favorite park programs including (but not limited to): Interpretation (ranger guided programs)Environmental education Visitor services Safety (e.g. SAR - search and rescue) Research Natural resource management and protection Cultural resource preservation and management Donations can be made by check or money order, payable to "National Park Service" and sent to : "National Park Service" Park Superintendent Everglades National Park 40001 State Road 9336,Homestead, FL 33034-6733         You can also donate to the park's friends group.  South Florida National Park Trust This group supports many park activities and outreach efforts. We thank you for your past support and look forward to future partnerships.
